title: Business Analyst, Operations
description:
About Us

TMB is the community-driven entertainment company engaging more than 250 million consumers worldwide across streaming TV, social media, web and print. Our portfolio of brands including FailArmy, Family Handyman, People Are Awesome, Reader's Digest, Taste of Home, The Healthy, and The Pet Collective, is powered by content that's inspired and created by our fans. Together our community sparks curiosity, fuels laughter, and inspires people to live big, full, fantastic lives. Learn more about our brands, our data-driven marketing solutions, our award-winning licensing services, and much more at trustedmediabrands.com.

About The Role

We are seeking a highly skilled and organized Business Analyst to join the Publishing Operations team. This person will be responsible for the day-to-day support of our Asset Management, Content Creation and Workflow Management tools, with a focus on the implementation and support of our new Video DAM. This role will require the ability to complete system administrative tasks, business analysis and managing projects.

About The You

You are detail-oriented with an interest in data management, end user support and triaging system issues. You are experienced in configuring Data Asset Management systems with a focus on video and image management. You are quick to learn new software, applications and processes and are experienced in a fast-pasted, high-volume environment.

This is a hybrid position out of Gurgaon location and requires you to be in the office multiple days a week. Your workday is expected to overlap 4 hours with US CST time zone.

Responsibilities: your day-day:


Act as a liaison between end-users, stakeholders and third-party vendor representatives
Configure and update system settings (permissions/meta data) based on end user requirements
Maintain and establish consistency of organizational structures in our DAMs
Develop and maintain meta data structures within supported DAMs while ensuring consistency and accuracy
Triage and resolve support tickets, escalating to vendors when issues cannot be resolved internally
Oversee the ingestion, archival and deletion of assets (video, image, text) across our DAMs
Research and test new system features or upgrades prior to deployment to end-users
Collaborate with stakeholders to establish, maintain and enforce asset and folder naming conventions
Review in-house processes and procedures for all tools to ensure best practices are being applied
Identify inefficiencies and work with teams to create/update workflows and procedures to improve
Assist in eliciting requirements to understand stakeholder needs and opportunities to enhance our DAMs
Assist in writing requirements or defect tickets based on information provided by stakeholders
Create process diagrams and other supportive materials based on information provided by stakeholders
Implement new features and functionalities to improve DAM system efficiency and effectiveness
Complete vendor analysis based on elicited requirements to identify potential solutions to meet user needs
Design end user trainings to onboard new team members or host user refresher trainings
Develop procedural documentation and establish best practices for enterprise-wide systems
Communicate updates, enhancements and changes to supported applications to all stakeholders



Qualifications: you have:


5+ year of relevant experience executing business analysis competencies
Experience with Adobe Creative Cloud applications, specifically Premiere and InDesign
Experience with Microsoft Applications, including Teams and Outlook and AirTable and Jira
Understanding of APIs and system integrations
Experience with DAM/SAAS platforms and integrations with other systems
Experience in triaging applications/end user issues and collaborating with vendors to resolve issues
Familiarity with Remote Desktop
Experience with both MAC and PC platforms
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical employees
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment
Detail oriented with strong organizational and project management skills
Capable of effectively working on multiple, concurrent projects
Experience working with global organizations and remote teams



Our Benefits:

We value our people and offer a collaborative and engaging culture. As a Trusted Media Brands employee, you will enjoy work/life balance, generous time off and comprehensive benefits and programs. Learn more about what life is like working at Trusted Media Brands at https://www.trustedmediabrands.com/careers/.

India Specific Benefits


Comprehensive Time Off policies
Maternity and Paternity Time off
Health Insurance & Wellness Benefits including access to OPD consultations*, Gym/Yoga studios, Teleconsultation/Telemedicine*
Access to Mental Health Reimbursement
Annual Sport Reimbursement and Home Office Reimbursement
Office with in-house kitchenette
